cards.name: Resilient Wanderer
cards.text:
First strike
Discard a card: Resilient Wanderer gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Nomads understand many cultures and therefore travel without fear.
cards.originalText:
First strike
Discard a card from your hand: Resilient Wanderer gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Sacred Rites
cards.text: Discard any number of cards. Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.
cards.originalText: Discard any number of cards from your hand. Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Second Thoughts
cards.text:
Exile target attacking creature.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: It suddenly dawned on Jorin that farming was quite a noble profession.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target when Second Thoughts tries to resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Remove target attacking creature from the game.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Shelter
cards.text:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Good strategists seize opportunities. Great strategists make their own.

rulings.text: The legality of a spell's target is checked only as that spell begins to resolve. If Shelter gives the targeted creature protection from white, you'll still draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Soulcatcher
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature with flying dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Soulcatcher.
cards.flavor:
"Holy couriers guide aven spirits up to the home of the Ancestor."
—Mystic elder

rulings.text: If another creature with flying is dealt lethal damage at the same time as Soulcatcher, they'll be destroyed at the same time. Soulcatcher's ability won't save it.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature with flying is put into a graveyard from play, put a +1/+1 counter on Soulcatcher.

cards.name: Sphere of Duty
cards.text: If a green source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
cards.flavor: Duty subdues instinct.
cards.originalText: If a green source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

cards.name: Sphere of Grace
cards.text: If a black source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
cards.flavor: Grace repels darkness.
cards.originalText: If a black source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

cards.name: Sphere of Law
cards.text: If a red source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
cards.flavor: Law smothers anarchy.
cards.originalText: If a red source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

cards.name: Sphere of Reason
cards.text: If a blue source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
cards.flavor: Reason exposes deception.
cards.originalText: If a blue source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

cards.name: Sphere of Truth
cards.text: If a white source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
cards.flavor: Truth tempers fanaticism.
cards.originalText: If a white source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

cards.name: Spiritualize
cards.text:
Until end of turn, whenever target creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"There is purity in all things. Even hatred."
—Lieutenant Kirtar
cards.originalText:
Until end of turn, whenever target creature deals damage, you gain that much life. 
Draw a card.

cards.name: Tattoo Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has protection from enchantments. This effect doesn't remove Tattoo Ward.
Sacrifice Tattoo Ward: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has protection from enchantments. This effect doesn't remove Tattoo Ward.
Sacrifice Tattoo Ward: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Testament of Faith
cards.text: {X}: Testament of Faith becomes an X/X Wall creature with defender in addition to its other types until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Belief in the Ancestor is admirable, but our enemies often demand something more . . . tangible."
—Pianna, nomad captain

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {X}: Testament of Faith becomes an X/X Wall creature until end of turn. It's still an enchantment. (Walls can't attack.)

cards.name: Tireless Tribe
cards.text: Discard a card: Tireless Tribe gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "We've survived starvation, dwarf attacks, and heatstroke. Why should a little sandstorm bother us?"
cards.originalText: Discard a card from your hand: Tireless Tribe gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wayward Angel
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Wayward Angel gets +3/+3, is black, has trample, and has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature."

rulings.text: When you have seven or more cards in your graveyard, this card is black. It is not white and black.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Wayward Angel to tap.
Threshold Wayward Angel gets +3/+3, is black, has trample, and has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Aboshan, Cephalid Emperor
cards.text:
Tap an untapped Cephalid you control: Tap target permanent.
{U}{U}{U}: Tap all creatures without flying.
cards.flavor: "No one can fight the tide forever."
cards.originalText:
Tap an untapped Cephalid you control: Tap target permanent.
{U}{U}{U}: Tap all creatures without flying.

cards.name: Aboshan's Desire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Threshold — Enchanted creature has shroud as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature has flying.
Threshold Enchanted creature can't be the target of spells or abilities. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Aether Burst
cards.text: Return up to X target creatures to their owners' hands, where X is one plus the number of cards named Aether Burst in all graveyards as you cast this spell.
cards.flavor: As fleeting as a cephalid's promise.
cards.originalText: Return up to X target creatures to their owners' hands, where X is one plus the number of Æther Burst cards in all graveyards as you play Æther Burst.

cards.name: Amugaba
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}, Discard a card: Return Amugaba to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The aven claim it feeds on thunder and rainbows.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{U}, Discard a card from your hand: Return Amugaba to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Aura Graft
cards.text: Gain control of target Aura that's attached to a permanent. Attach it to another permanent it can enchant.
cards.flavor: "It's not really stealing. It's more like extended borrowing."

rulings.text: If there is no legal place to move the enchantment, then it doesn't move but you still control it.
Aura Graft's effect has no duration. You'll retain control of the Aura until the game ends, the Aura leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of the Aura.
You can target an Aura you already control just to move that Aura to a new permanent.

cards.originalText: Move target enchantment that's enchanting a permanent to another permanent it can enchant. Gain control of that enchantment. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Aven Fisher
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Fisher dies, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Aven Fisher is put into a graveyard from play, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Aven Smokeweaver
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor: In a world still pained from burns, some are born already scarred.
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from red

cards.name: Aven Windreader
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of their library.
cards.flavor: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of his or her library.

cards.name: Balshan Beguiler
cards.text: Whenever Balshan Beguiler deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals the top two cards of their library. You choose one of those cards and put it into their graveyard.
cards.originalText: Whenever Balshan Beguiler deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals the top two cards of his or her library. You choose one of those cards and put it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Balshan Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{U}, Discard a card: Return Balshan Griffin to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It helps to have an extra direction in which to run.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{U}, Discard a card from your hand: Return Balshan Griffin to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Bamboozle
cards.text: Target player reveals the top four cards of their library. You choose two of those cards and put them into that player's graveyard. Put the rest on top of their library in any order.
cards.originalText: Target player reveals the top four cards of his or her library. You choose two of those cards and put them into his or her graveyard. Put the rest on top of his or her library in any order.

cards.name: Battle of Wits
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 200 or more cards in your library, you win the game.
cards.flavor: The wizard who reads a thousand books is powerful. The wizard who memorizes a thousand books is insane.

rulings.text: Battle of Wits has an "intervening 'if' clause." This means that if you don't have 200 or more cards in your library at the beginning of your upkeep, the ability won't trigger. If the ability does trigger, but you have fewer than 200 cards in your library when the ability resolves, the ability will do nothing.
In tournaments, you must be able to shuffle your entire deck within a reasonable amount of time.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 200 or more cards in your library, you win the game.

cards.name: Careful Study
cards.text: Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
cards.flavor: Books are like crops—they must be thinned for best yield.
cards.originalText: Draw two cards, then discard two cards from your hand.

cards.name: Cephalid Broker
cards.text: {T}: Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards.
cards.flavor: Cephalids value the free exchange of ideas—except for the "free" part.

rulings.text: You draw two cards and discard two cards all while Cephalid Broker's ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards from his or her hand.

cards.name: Cephalid Looter
cards.text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.
cards.flavor: "Amazing, isn't it, what humans will throw away when they're drowning?"
cards.originalText: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Cephalid Retainer
cards.text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Cephalids whisper flattery in your ear, put jewels in your hand, spin dreams in your head, and stick knives in your back.
cards.originalText: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.

cards.name: Cephalid Scout
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The more they survey the dreadful dry expanses, the more the cephalids thirst to tame them.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{U}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card.

cards.name: Cephalid Shrine
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, counter that spell unless that player pays {X}, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as the spell.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, counter that spell unless that player pays {X}, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as the spell.

cards.name: Chamber of Manipulation
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}, Discard a card: Gain control of target creature until end of turn."
cards.flavor: Politics is just a subtle form of mind control—and cephalids are master politicians.

rulings.text: Remember that the creature does not gain Haste, so you can't attack with that creature or use any ability with {T} in the activation cost during the turn you take control of it.
The creature does not untap if it is tapped.

cards.originalText: Enchanted land has "{T}, Discard a card from your hand: Gain control of target creature until end of turn."

cards.name: Cognivore
cards.text:
Flying
Cognivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of instant cards in all graveyards.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Cognivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of instant cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Concentrate
cards.text: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: "The treasure in my mind is greater than any worldly glory."
cards.originalText: Draw three cards.

cards.name: Cultural Exchange
cards.text: Choose any number of creatures target player controls. Choose the same number of creatures another target player controls. Those players exchange control of those creatures. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText: Choose any number of creatures target player controls. Choose the same number of creatures another target player controls. Those players exchange control of those creatures. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Deluge
cards.text: Tap all creatures without flying.
cards.flavor:
"From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better."
—Emperor Aboshan
cards.originalText: Tap all creatures without flying.

cards.name: Dematerialize
cards.text:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Divert
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target unless that spell's controller pays {2}.
cards.flavor: "What's the fun of being a wizard if you can't mess with people's heads?"
cards.originalText: Change the target of target spell with a single target unless that spell's controller pays {2}.

cards.name: Dreamwinder
cards.text:
Dreamwinder can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}, Sacrifice an Island: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Dreamwinder can't attack unless defending player controls an island.
{U}, Sacrifice an island: Target land becomes an island until end of turn.

cards.name: Escape Artist
cards.text:
Escape Artist can't be blocked.
{U}, Discard a card: Return Escape Artist to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "Not even my shadow knows where I am."
cards.originalText:
Escape Artist is unblockable.
{U}, Discard a card from your hand: Return Escape Artist to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Extract
cards.text: Search target player's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.flavor: To say Nixar had a splitting headache would be a bit of an understatement.
cards.originalText: Search target player's library for a card and remove that card from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Fervent Denial
cards.text:
Counter target spell.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor:
"Your tenacity is admirable. And futile."
—Emperor Aboshan
cards.originalText:
Counter target spell.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Immobilizing Ink
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Enchanted creature has "{1}, Discard a card: Untap this creature."
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Enchanted creature has "{1}, Discard a card from your hand: Untap this creature."

cards.name: Laquatus's Creativity
cards.text: Target player draws cards equal to the number of cards in their hand, then discards that many cards.
cards.flavor: One never knows when inspiration will bubble up.
cards.originalText: Target player draws cards equal to the number of cards in his or her hand, then discards that many cards.

cards.name: Patron Wizard
cards.text: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor: "The best way to teach is by example."

rulings.text: Since the cost does not include the {T} symbol, it can tap itself even on the turn it enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Pedantic Learning
cards.text: Whenever a land card is put into your graveyard from your library, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Even the trivial can inspire.
cards.originalText: Whenever a land card is put into your graveyard from your library, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Peek
cards.text:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Sometimes you have to read between the minds.
cards.originalText:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Persuasion
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
You control enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: "Protocol demands that you bow down before me. I always stand on protocol."
cards.originalText: You control enchanted creature.

cards.name: Phantom Whelp
cards.text: When Phantom Whelp attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor: It lurks in the mist, waiting for stragglers to fall behind. When the fog clears, nothing remains but footprints.
cards.originalText: When Phantom Whelp attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat.

cards.name: Predict
cards.text: Choose a card name, then target player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard. If that card has the chosen name, you draw two cards. Otherwise, you draw a card.
cards.originalText: Name a card, then put the top card of target player's library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the named card, you draw two cards. Otherwise, you draw a card.

cards.name: Psionic Gift
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
cards.flavor: For sale: Complete wizard's library. Rare scrolls, grimoires, and works of ancient spellcrafting! Slightly abridged.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.name: Pulsating Illusion
cards.text:
Flying
Discard a card: Pulsating Illusion gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Discard a card from your hand: Pulsating Illusion gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Puppeteer
cards.text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
cards.flavor: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."

rulings.text: You decide on resolution whether or not to tap or untap the creature.

cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Tap or untap target creature.

cards.name: Repel
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"I have a hunch we'll be seeing that one again soon."
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.originalText: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Rites of Refusal
cards.text: Discard any number of cards. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3} for each card discarded this way.
cards.originalText: Discard any number of cards from your hand. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3} for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Scrivener
cards.text: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A good memory is no match for a good scribe.
cards.originalText: When Scrivener comes into play, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Shifty Doppelganger
cards.text: {3}{U}, Exile Shifty Doppelganger: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, that creature gains haste until end of turn. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice that creature. If you do, return Shifty Doppelganger to the battlefield.

rulings.text: If the creature is not still on the battlefield at beginning of the End step, then you do not return this card to the battlefield.

This card has received errata such that putting a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield is now optional. This means you no longer need a third-party to verify that you don't have any creature cards in your hand if you don't put something onto the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {3}{U}, Remove Shifty Doppelganger from the game: Put a creature card from your hand into play. That creature gains haste until end of turn. At end of turn, sacrifice that creature. If you do, return Shifty Doppelganger to play.

cards.name: Standstill
cards.text: When a player casts a spell, sacrifice Standstill. If you do, each of that player's opponents draws three cards.
cards.flavor: "Take your time."

rulings.text: It only works once. If someone casts another spell after it triggers, but before that trigger resolves, then it will trigger again. The first time one of these triggers resolves, it will be sacrificed for the full effect. Any additional triggers on the stack will do nothing when they resolve because you will be unable to sacrifice it additional times.

cards.originalText: When a player plays a spell, sacrifice Standstill. If you do, each of that player's opponents draws three cards.

cards.name: Syncopate
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Memories can't simply be washed away. The mind must be scrubbed clean."
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that spell is countered this way, remove it from the game instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Think Tank
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Cephalids seek knowledge not to better themselves, but to best others.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.

cards.name: Thought Devourer
cards.text:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by four.
cards.flavor: Thinking is hard.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you are affected by Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a player's maximum hand size to four) and then put Thought Devourer onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size would be zero. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be four.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by four.

cards.name: Thought Eater
cards.text:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by three.
cards.flavor: The first memory it sucks out of its host is how to get rid of it.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you are affected by Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a player's maximum hand size to four) and then put Thought Eater onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size would be one. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be four.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by three.

cards.name: Thought Nibbler
cards.text:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by two.
cards.flavor: Balshan wizards have long used them to gnaw away the memories they wish to forget.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you are affected by Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a player's maximum hand size to four) and then put Thought Nibbler onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size would be two. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be four.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by two.

cards.name: Time Stretch
cards.text: Target player takes two extra turns after this one.
cards.flavor: There's lots of time like the present.

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Target player takes two extra turns after this one.

cards.name: Touch of Invisibility
cards.text:
Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Cephalids specialize in things unseen, be they politics, betrayal, or themselves.
cards.originalText:
Target creature is unblockable this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Traumatize
cards.text: Target player puts the top half of their library, rounded down, into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: Dreads had half a mind to leave.

rulings.text: The player can put the cards in their graveyard in any order they choose.

cards.originalText: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Treetop Sentinel
cards.text: Flying, protection from green
cards.flavor: Crian's patrols afford him plenty of opportunity to take potshots at the "dirtwalkers" far below.
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from green

cards.name: Unifying Theory
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player may pay {2}. If the player does, they draw a card.
cards.flavor: Scribbles of a lunatic and formulas of a genius are often indistinguishable.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, that player may pay {2}. If the player does, he or she draws a card.

cards.name: Upheaval
cards.text: Return all permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: The calm comes after the storm.
cards.originalText: Return all permanents to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Words of Wisdom
cards.text: You draw two cards, then each other player draws a card.
cards.flavor: Knowledge can't be kept in a bottle or sealed in a box. It yearns to be spread and shared.
cards.originalText: You draw two cards, then each other player draws a card.

cards.name: Afflict
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: When one of the Patriarch's champions displeased him, he would only shake his finger. That was enough.
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Bloodcurdler
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Bloodcurdler gets +1/+1 and has "At the beginning of your end step, exile two cards from your graveyard."
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.
Threshold Bloodcurdler gets +1/+1 and has "At the end of your turn, remove two cards in your graveyard from the game." (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Braids, Cabal Minion
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: "Home is where you can find a decent graveyard and strangers can disappear without awkward questions."

rulings.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, triggered abilities you control will resolve after triggered abilities your opponents control. If an opponent controls Braids and you control a triggered ability that puts a permanent onto the battlefield, you won't be able to sacrifice that permanent to satisfy Braids's ability.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Buried Alive
cards.text: Search your library for up to three creature cards and put them into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.

rulings.text: You can look in your library and then choose to find any number from zero to three creatures after you look at it.

cards.originalText: Search your library for up to three creature cards and put them into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cabal Inquisitor
cards.text: Threshold — {1}{B}, {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Threshold {1}{B}, {T}, Remove two cards in your graveyard from the game: Target player discards a card from his or her hand. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery. (Play this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Cabal Patriarch
cards.text:
{2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{2}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{2}{B}, Remove a creature card in your graveyard from the game: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cabal Shrine
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards X cards, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, that player discards X cards from his or her hand, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

cards.name: Caustic Tar
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target player loses 3 life."
cards.flavor:
"Twisted magic, twisted fate,
Force the land to ooze with hate."
—Cabal chant
cards.originalText: Enchanted land has "{T}: Target player loses 3 life."

cards.name: Childhood Horror
cards.text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Childhood Horror gets +2/+2 and can't block.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Threshold Childhood Horror gets +2/+2 and can't block. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Coffin Purge
cards.text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Flashback {B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.
Flashback {B} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Crypt Creeper
cards.text: Sacrifice Crypt Creeper: Exile target card from a graveyard.
cards.flavor: To unearth its dinner, it inters itself.

rulings.text: You must be able to target a card in a graveyard to activate Crypt Creeper's ability. It can't target itself.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Crypt Creeper: Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Cursed Monstrosity
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Cursed Monstrosity becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card.
cards.flavor:
"Run away! It's an . . . um . . . run away!"
—Nomad sentry
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Cursed Monstrosity becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card from your hand.

cards.name: Decaying Soil
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile a card from your graveyard.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Decaying Soil has "Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, return that card to your hand."

rulings.text: Multiple creatures going to the graveyard at the same time all end up there at once, so either all of them or none of them will cause the trigger to go off, depending on whether or not Threshold was met prior to the creatures going to the graveyard.
The ability in Threshold will trigger only if Threshold was met before the creature goes to the graveyard. So the one that causes Threshold to be met will not trigger the ability.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a card in your graveyard from the game.
Threshold Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from play, you may pay {1}. If you do, return that card to your hand. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Decompose
cards.text: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Sheesh! How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber
cards.originalText: Remove up to three target cards in a single graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Dirty Wererat
cards.text:
{B}, Discard a card: Regenerate Dirty Wererat.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Dirty Wererat gets +2/+2 and can't block.
cards.originalText:
{B}, Discard a card from your hand: Regenerate Dirty Wererat.
Threshold Dirty Wererat gets +2/+2 and can't block. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Dusk Imp
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: It despises humans and squirrels and beasts and dwarves and cephalids . . . well, it despises just about everything.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Entomb
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Execute
cards.text:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch
cards.originalText:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Face of Fear
cards.text: {2}{B}, Discard a card: Face of Fear gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"It's only frightened five people to death. Not my best work."
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.originalText: {2}{B}, Discard a card from your hand: Face of Fear can't be blocked this turn except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.

cards.name: Famished Ghoul
cards.text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Famished Ghoul: Exile up to two target cards from a single graveyard.
cards.flavor: Memories have distinct tastes. Its favorites are the sickly sweetness of lost love and the bitter smokiness of cruel murder.
cards.originalText: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Famished Ghoul: Remove up to two target cards in a single graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Filthy Cur
cards.text: Whenever Filthy Cur is dealt damage, you lose that much life.
cards.flavor: Some things even fleas won't bite.
cards.originalText: Whenever Filthy Cur is dealt damage, you lose that much life.

cards.name: Fledgling Imp
cards.text: {B}, Discard a card: Fledgling Imp gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Imps aren't born knowing how to fly—just how to annoy.
cards.originalText: {B}, Discard a card from your hand: Fledgling Imp gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Frightcrawler
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Frightcrawler gets +2/+2 and can't block.
cards.originalText:
Frightcrawler can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.
Threshold Frightcrawler gets +2/+2 and can't block. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Ghastly Demise
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature if its toughness is less than or equal to the number of cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Anyone can snap her fingers and yank a soul. I prefer to kill creatively."
—Braids, dementia summoner

rulings.text: This card is not in the graveyard until after you destroy the creature. So it does not count itself when determining the maximum toughness.

cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature if its toughness is less than or equal to the number of cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Gravestorm
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent may exile a card from their graveyard. If that player doesn't, you may draw a card.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent may remove a card in his or her graveyard from the game. If that player doesn't, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Haunting Echoes
cards.text: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: While you're searching the player's library, you don't have to find all the cards with the same name as an exiled card if you don't want to. You can leave any number of them in that player's library.

cards.originalText: Remove all cards in target player's graveyard other than basic land cards from the game. Search that player's library for all cards with the same name as cards removed this way and remove them from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
